message:
Correctness_Score: 1.0
Style_Score: 0.9
Simplicity_Score: 0.9
Robustness_Score: 0.8
Reasoning: The solution is functionally correct: it computes the maximum achievable energy per cell via monotone relaxations (BFS-like updates) and will correctly decide reachability, so it should pass all valid testcases. Style is good — there is a concise explanation of the core idea and clear variable names, though more docstrings/comments could help. The code is simple and efficient in structure with only a minor unused variable (max_possible_energy) as a small redundancy. Robustness is solid under the stated constraints, but it omits explicit sanity checks (start/goal presence) and could be pushed on worst-case performance, so I rated it slightly lower there.
